column4: is it normal for ubuntu to take a while to boot the install cycle?
it hass been reading the CRrom for the past 20 minutes
verify your written copy (md5 the checksum)
or try switching to a different runlevel and see if something interesting is there
make sure that your motherboard supports booting from usb (and that your BIOS is set accordingly)
did you burn on DVD or CD? Try burning on CD (if you burnt on DVD before). Try a slow speed burning, md5 the hash of the disc contents after burning etc...
can't you order an Ubuntu disc from launchpad anymore (and wait a little)?
maybe they stopped shipping them, but they sent out ubuntu discs for free
then you're sure it's not you're writer
try switching to runlevel 3 while the install fails/hangs (ctrl + alt + f3). Check the error logs
when it hangs (when installing) try pressing ctrl+alt+f3 (that should take you to runlevel 3). list what you see here

may be a broken disc according to http://www.linuxforums.org/forum/mandriva-linux-help/26241-cd-crashes-invalid-argument-mount-dev-loop0-solved.html (I would try taking out the cdrom / dvd players one by one)
a broken cd-romplayer I meant (not really a disc)
ok, I'll try to stay on this channel. I have no experience with this specific error but I should be able to help you through general linux troubleshooting
shiny new ubuntu installation coming up soon ;-)
